headline: The Chip Industry Has Too Many Eggs in the AI Basket
summary: The chip industry has cashed in on the artificial-intelligence bonanza, sending the profits and stocks of companies like  Nvidia  and Taiwan Semiconductor Manufacturing Co. to unprecedented heights.  With President Trump’s tariff threats and rising potential for a global economic slowdown, it is becoming harder to ignore how everything other than AI isn’t doing all that well.  TSMC  the world’s largest chip maker and an industry bellwether, on Thursday reinforced the sense that the industry’s eggs are largely in the AI basket.

raw.headline: The Chip Industry Has Too Many Eggs in the AI Basket
raw.summary: The chip industry has cashed in on the artificial-intelligence bonanza, sending the profits and stocks of companies like  Nvidia  and Taiwan Semiconductor Manufacturing Co. to unprecedented heights.  With President Trump’s tariff threats and rising potential for a global economic slowdown, it is becoming harder to ignore how everything other than AI isn’t doing all that well.  TSMC  the world’s largest chip maker and an industry bellwether, on Thursday reinforced the sense that the industry’s eggs are largely in the AI basket.

headline: Nvidia & AMD sell-off, Hertz extends gains: Trending Tickers
summary: Wealth host Brad Smith and Yahoo Finance Senior Reporter Alexandra Canal examine some of today's trending tickers. The chipmaker sell-off continues, with Nvidia (NVDA) and Advanced Micro Devices (AMD) extending losses sparked by new chip export restrictions that add costs for the company. Hertz (HTZ) extends gains fueled by billionaire investor Bill Ackman's firm, Pershing Square Capital Management, disclosing its large stake in the rental car company. To watch more expert insights and analysis on the latest market action, check out more Wealth here.

headline: Better Artificial Intelligence (AI) Stock: Alphabet vs. Nvidia
summary: Tech giants Alphabet (NASDAQ: GOOG) (NASDAQ: GOOGL) and Nvidia (NASDAQ: NVDA) are among the businesses at the forefront of artificial intelligence (AI), making them compelling AI investments.  Nvidia is a leader in the semiconductor hardware AI needs to operate on cloud computing infrastructure, such as Alphabet's Google Cloud platform.  Alphabet's software products deliver AI's benefits to consumers.

headline: Nvidia Stock Falls for a Second Straight Day. Shares Are Down 30% From Their High.
summary: Nvidia  stock is in the red for a second straight day.  Nvidia stock’s two-day slide comes after the chip maker said the U.S. would now require a license to export some of its chips to China.  As a result, Nvidia will take a $5.5 billion charge in the current quarter for canceled sales.

headline: Nvidia's New Mainstream Graphics Cards Look Good, but Price Is a Wildcard
summary: Nvidia (NASDAQ: NVDA) has now filled out its lineup of Blackwell-based gaming graphics cards with the unveiling of the RTX 5060 and RTX 5060 Ti.  AMD launched higher-end graphics cards as part of its RX 9000 series last month, and mainstream cards are likely to come soon.  Nvidia is getting somewhat aggressive on pricing with the RTX 5060 and RTX 5060 Ti, which makes sense, given the competitive environment.

headline: 2 Top Quantum Computing Stocks to Buy in April
summary: Quantum computing hasn't received much attention lately, with all the focus on the general economy and the effects of President Donald Trump's tariff plans.  The two that I think are top buys right now are Alphabet (NASDAQ: GOOG) (NASDAQ: GOOGL) and Nvidia (NASDAQ: NVDA).  Alphabet kicked off the latest round of hype in December when it announced that its Willow quantum computing chip had a novel way of reducing computational errors inherent to quantum computers.

headline: S&P, Nasdaq futures rise after selloff; UnitedHealth plunges after forecast cut
summary: (Reuters) -Futures tied to the S&P 500 and the Nasdaq regained some ground on Thursday on the final trading day of the week, with focus on U.S.-Japan tariff talks, while UnitedHealth's shares fell sharply following a forecast cut by the insurer.  U.S. President Donald Trump said the country had made "big progress" in talks with Japan, one of the first rounds of face-to-face negotiations since his sweeping imposition of duties on global imports roiled markets and stoked recession fears.  Meanwhile, UnitedHealth plummeted 19% after lowering its annual profit forecast on expectations of high medical costs for the remainder of the year.

raw.headline: S&P, Nasdaq futures rise after selloff; UnitedHealth plunges after forecast cut

U.S. President Donald Trump said the country had made "big progress" in talks with Japan, one of the first rounds of face-to-face negotiations since his sweeping imposition of duties on global imports roiled markets and stoked recession fears.  Meanwhile, UnitedHealth plummeted 19% after lowering its annual profit forecast on expectations of high medical costs for the remainder of the year.

headline: Nvidia CEO stresses importance of China market in Beijing visit, Chinese state media reports
summary: BEIJING (Reuters) -Nvidia CEO Jensen Huang said on Thursday that China was a very important market for Nvidia after the U.S. imposed a ban  on sales of its H20 artificial intelligence chips to the country.  "We hope to continue to cooperate with China," Huang said in a meeting with Ren Hongbin, head of the China Council for the Promotion of International Trade, according to China state broadcaster CCTV.

headline: Ives: It's 'Scariest Time' Ever Seen for Tech Investors
summary: Dan Ives, Wedbush Securities managing director, discusses the state of the tech sector amid US President Donald Trump's tariff announcements. Speaking on Bloomberg Television, Ives says levies in their current form are "untenable." He also adds that a decoupling of US tech from the China market is not possible. "For the first time in 30 years, the US tech is ahead of China and what you're essentially doing with these tariffs, you're cutting the knees of US tech, sending it back years," Ives tells Bloomberg Television.
